translated: The Chapter on Entering the Dharma Realm of the Flower Ornament Sutra, Part 40
Two-Character Contemplation Gate
Kaifuyi Tongsansi Tejin Shi Honglu Qing

Su Guo Gong Shiyi Qianhu Chu Zi Zeng Sikong Shi Daguan Zheng Hao Daguanghui Daxingshansi Sanzang Shamen Bukong Respectfully Translated by Imperial Decree At that time, the youth Sudhana descended from the heavenly palace.
He headed towards the city of Kapilavastu.
He arrived at the place of the youth Sumati.
He bowed his head in reverence and stood to one side.
He said, Holy One,
I have already given rise to the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment.
But I do not yet know how bodhisattvas learn the bodhisattva practices.
How do they cultivate the bodhisattva path?
I have heard that the holy one is good at teaching.
Please explain it to me.
At that time, the youth told Sudhana,
Good man, I have attained the bodhisattva liberation.
Called 'well-versed in the arts.'
I always chant and uphold the fundamental syllable that enters this liberation.
When chanting the syllable A, it is called the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ where bodhisattvas enter the realm of non-differentiation through their majestic virtue.
It is because one realizes that all dharmas are originally unborn.
When chanting the syllable Ra,
one enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of boundless distinctions.
It is because one realizes that all dharmas are free from defilements.
When chanting the syllable Pa,
one enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the limit of the dharma realm.
It is because one realizes that the supreme truth of all dharmas cannot be attained.
When chanting the syllable Sa, one enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that universally cuts through distinctions.
It is because one realizes that all dharmas are devoid of activities.
When chanting the syllable Na with the tip of the tongue,
one enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the limit without Älaya.
It is because one realizes that the nature and characteristics of all dharmas cannot be attained.
When chanting the syllable La,
one enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ free from defilements.
Because one realizes that all dharmas transcend the world.
Because the causes and conditions of the branch of craving are never manifested.
When the letter na is pronounced,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of irreversible applied practice.
Because one realizes that all dharmas are tamed, tranquil, suchness, equal, and without discrimination.
When the letter ma is pronounced,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the adamantine realm. Because one realizes that all dharmas are free from bondage and liberation.
When the letter na is pronounced,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the universal wheel.
Because one realizes that all dharmas are free from heat, pretense, and defilement, and attain coolness.
When the letter sa is pronounced,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the ocean treasury.
Because one realizes that all dharmas are unobstructed.
When the letter va is pronounced,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of universal birth and peaceful abiding.
Because one realizes that all dharmas are beyond the path of language.
When the letter ta is pronounced,
Entering the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ gateway of illuminating dust and defilements,
Realizing that all dharmas are suchness, unmoving.
When the syllable ya is pronounced,
Entering the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ gateway of distinctions and accumulations,
Realizing that all dharmas are truly unborn.
When the syllable sa is pronounced,
Entering the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ gateway of universal radiance extinguishing afflictions,
Realizing that the characteristics of all dharmas are unobtainable in terms of restraint and support.
When the syllable ka is pronounced,
Entering the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ gateway of distinctions and categories,
Realizing that the agent of all dharmas is unobtainable.
When the syllable sa is pronounced,
Entering the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ gateway of directly pouring down heavy rain,
Realizing that the equality of all dharmas over time is unobtainable.
When the syllable ma is pronounced,
Entering the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ gateway of great swiftness and many peaks,
Because one realizes that the nature of grasping at mine of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When pronouncing the syllable ga,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of universal wheel growth and nourishment.
Because one realizes that the nature of grasping at activity of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When pronouncing the syllable tha,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the non-differentiation of suchness.
Because one realizes that the location of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When pronouncing the syllable ja,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the pure source of worldly transmigration.
Because one realizes that the nature of production of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When pronouncing the syllable sa,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the adornment of mindfulness of all Buddhas.
Because one realizes that the nature of peace of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When pronouncing the syllable dha,
One enters the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the path of observing the dharma realm.
Because one realizes that the nature of upholding the realm of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
ô„™¢ When pronouncing the letter sha,
one enters the gate of prajna paramita that accords with all the teachings of the Buddha.
This is because one realizes that the nature of all dharmas is quiescent and cannot be attained.
ô„‘Œ When pronouncing the letter kha, one enters the gate of prajna paramita that is the wisdom treasury of the ground of practice and cause.
This is because one realizes that the nature of all dharmas is like space and cannot be attained.
ô„š´ When pronouncing the letter ká¹£a,
one enters the gate of prajna paramita that is the treasury of discerning and ceasing the ocean of karma.
This is because one realizes that the nature of all dharmas is exhaustible and cannot be attained.
ô†¶© When pronouncing the letter sa,
one enters the gate of prajna paramita that destroys afflictions and illuminates with purity.
This is because one realizes that the nature of all dharmas abiding in the proper and improper ways is immovable and cannot be attained.
ô„“ When pronouncing the letter nya,
one enters the gate of prajna paramita that gives rise to worldly discrimination.
This is because one realizes that the nature of all dharmas that can be known and the knower cannot be attained.
At the syllable ra,
One enters the Gate of Prajna Paramita of the Dharma Realm of Wisdom Path that Enters the Wheel of Birth and Death in Reverse,
And realizes that the meaning and nature of all dharmas cannot be grasped.
At the syllable va,
One enters the Gate of Prajna Paramita of the Dharma Realm of Adorning All Palaces,
And realizes that the destructible nature of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
At the syllable ca,
One enters the Gate of Prajna Paramita of the Dharma Realm of the Treasury of Cultivation and Application, and the Differences in the Path,
And realizes that the nature of desires and pleasures covering all dharmas cannot be obtained.
At the syllable sa,
One enters the Gate of Prajna Paramita of Directly Seeing the Buddhas of the Ten Directions,
And realizes that the nature of all dharmas that can be remembered cannot be obtained.
At the syllable ha,
One enters the Gate of Prajna Paramita of the Treasury of the Ocean of the Power of Endurance of All Sentient Beings,
Because one realizes that the nature of all phenomena that can be called out is unobtainable.
When reciting the syllable ta,
One enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that enters the source of the ocean of all merits and cultivates the practice to the bottom.
Because one realizes that the nature of all phenomena is courageous and unobtainable.
When reciting the syllable ga,
One enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that upholds the ocean treasury of the clouds of all dharmas.
Because one realizes that the nature of all phenomena is thick and equal and unobtainable.
When reciting the syllable ca,
One enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that vows to go to the ten directions and manifests the presence of all buddhas.
Because one realizes that the nature of all phenomena is accumulation and unobtainable.
When reciting the syllable na,
One enters the gateway of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that accumulates koá¹­is of syllables in the wheel of syllables.
Because one realizes that all phenomena are free from disputes, without going or coming, and unobtainable in terms of walking, standing, sitting, or lying down.
When reciting the syllable pha,
The gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of entering the stage of maturing all sentient beings and going to the site of enlightenment.
Realizing that all dharmas are completely filled with fruits and rewards that cannot be obtained.
When chanting the syllable sa,
Enter the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the light wheel of the treasury of unobstructed liberation that universally illuminates.
Realizing that the nature of the accumulation of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When chanting the syllable ya,
Enter the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of expounding the realm of all buddha-dharmas.
Realizing that the characteristics of the aging nature of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When chanting the syllable Å›a,
Enter the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the clouds and thunder of the Dharma illuminating all space that universally illuminates.
Realizing that the traces of the accumulation of all dharmas cannot be obtained.
When chanting the syllable á¹­ha,
Enter the gate of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ of the ultimate benefit of sentient beings without self.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Because one realizes that the nature of all phenomena is unobtainable.
When uttering the syllable ta,
One enters the gate of prajna paramita, the treasury of the Dharma wheel without distinction.
Because one realizes that the ultimate destination of all phenomena is unobtainable.
Good man, when I utter such fundamental syllables to enter [the Dharma],
These forty-two prajna paramitas are foremost.
One enters innumerable and countless gates of prajna paramita.
Moreover, good man, such syllable gates
Are able to awaken and enter the limit of the emptiness of phenomena.
Except for such syllables,
Indicating the emptiness of all phenomena,
Nothing else can be obtained.
Why is it so? The meaning of such syllables cannot be spoken,
Cannot be revealed,
Cannot be grasped,ğŸ”½Cannot be written,
Cannot be observed,
Because it is free from all characteristics.
Good man, it is like space, which is the destination of all things.
This gate of all letters is also like this.
The meaning of the emptiness of all dharmas enters this gate.
Only then can it be revealed.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas attain skillful wisdom in entering this gate of all letters,
with regard to all the sounds and their meanings,
they will be unobstructed.
With regard to the equality and emptiness of all dharmas,
they will be able to fully realize and uphold them.
With regard to all the sounds and languages, they will attain skillfulness.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas
are able to listen to this entry into all letters,
the seal of the syllable ağŸ”½having heard it, they will accept and uphold it,
recite it, and explain it to others.
They will not be greedy for fame and profit.
By this cause and condition, they will attain twenty kinds of supreme merits.
What are the twenty?
Namely, they will attain strong mindfulness,
attain superior shame and conscience,
attain firm power,
attain the purport of the Dharma,
attain supreme enlightenment,
attain exceptional wisdom,
attain unobstructed eloquence,
One attains the door of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s.
One attains the absence of doubt.
One attains the absence of anger or attachment when encountering agreeable or disagreeable speech.
One attains the state of dwelling in equality without high or low.
One attains skill in the speech and sounds of sentient beings.
One attains skill in the aggregates, skill in the sense bases, and skill in the elements.
One attains skill in dependent origination, skill in causes, skill in conditions, and skill in the Dharma.
One attains skill in the knowledge of the superiority of faculties, skill in the knowledge of the minds of others,
One attains skill in observing the stars and calendars.
One attains skill in the knowledge of the divine ear, skill in the knowledge of recollecting past lives, skill in the knowledge of spiritual powers, and skill in the knowledge of birth and death.
One attains skill in the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements.
One attains skill in the knowledge of what is possible and impossible.
One attains skill in the path of proper conduct such as coming and going.
These are the twenty kinds of supreme merits that one attains.
Good man, I only know this fundamental knowledge of syllables that enters all liberations.
As for the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas,
they are skilled in all the worldly skillful dharmas.
With wisdom, he penetrates
and reaches the other shore.
How could I know or speak of his virtues and practices?
At that time, the youth Sudhana
bowed his head in respect to the feet of Samantabhadra
and circumambulated him countless times, gazing up at him with longing before leaving.
